long: Meaning: properly, to "spoil" (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to "make" (or "be") "good for nothing", i.e. "bad" (physically, socially or morally).  Usage: afflict, associate selves (by mistake for "H7462"), break (down, in pieces),   displease, (be, bring, do) evil (doer, entreat, man), show self friendly (by mistake for "H7462"), do harm, (do) hurt, (behave self, deal) ill, Ã— indeed, do mischief, punish, still, vex, (do) wicked (doer, -ly), be (deal, do) worse.  Source: a primitive root;
